page.title: 14Frickley Colliery Band
page.content: Frickley Colliery Band was established in 1884 as a village band.In 1904 the colliery took over the running of the band which changed its name to{Carlton {Main Frickley Colliery Brass Band.}It is financed by the N.U.M.Each miner pays 10p per week contribution. { Rehearsals}are from 7pm.till 9pm. on Mondays and Thursdays.A lot of players come from as far afield as Lancashire, Workington and Stoke.In the middle of the rehearsal is a 10 minute break.The men practise in a red brick building which stands next to the old swimming baths in{Westfield Lane. { Carlton Main Youth Band}was formed in 1972 as a training group for the adult band.There were 14 founder members but now there are more than 30 players registered in the National Brass Band Registry.
